alert.note: Alert for Inland Broward County; Inland Collier County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 4:51PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Collier, northern Mainland Monroe and northern Miami-Dade Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 451 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a funnel cloud along a line extending from 12 miles north of Big Cypress National Preserve to 9 miles south of Miccosukee Indian Reservation. Movement was west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Shark Valley Obs Tower, Big Cypress National Preserve, Fortymile Bend, Dade-Collier Training Airport and Everglades National Park. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes.

area.areaDesc: Inland Broward County; Inland Collier County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Mainland Monroe
